alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Franklin; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 12:53PM EDT until April 05 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Apalachicola River near Blountstown affecting Calhoun, Liberty, Franklin and Gulf Counties. For the Apalachicola River...including Woodruff L&D, Blountstown... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Apalachicola River near Blountstown. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Forest Road 115 in Liberty County at River Styx Campground will flood, isolating access to the site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CDT Wednesday /12:15 PM EDT Wednesday/ the stage was 18.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM CDT Wednesday /12:15 PM EDT Wednesday/ was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.2 feet on 07/28/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT /1000 PM EDT/.
